error.signature: go: updates to go.sum needed, disabled by -mod=readonly; to update run: go mod tidy
error.regex: updates to go\.sum needed|go mod tidy

verdict.summary: The go.sum file is missing entries needed for the current dependencies. Go modules require go.sum to verify dependency integrity. Running go mod tidy updates both go.mod and go.sum.

dead_ends.action: Deleting go.sum and regenerating from scratch
dead_ends.why_fails: While this works in isolation, it changes checksums for all dependencies, making the diff noisy and potentially introducing different versions than intended.

dead_ends.action: Using GONOSUMCHECK to skip checksum verification
dead_ends.why_fails: Disables security verification of downloaded modules. Supply chain attacks become possible. Not a fix, just hiding the problem.

workarounds.action: Run go mod tidy to update go.mod and go.sum
workarounds.how:
go mod tidy
# This adds missing entries and removes unused ones from go.sum
# Commit both go.mod and go.sum

workarounds.action: In CI, ensure go.sum is committed and up-to-date
workarounds.how:
# Add to CI pipeline:
go mod tidy
git diff --exit-code go.mod go.sum
# This fails the build if go.sum is out of date

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'updates to go.sum needed' is the newer Go error message. 'missing go.sum entry' is the older variant. Both indicate go.sum needs updating.
